001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
011
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
015
016import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLEventReader2;
017import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamWriter2;
018import org.codehaus.stax2.evt.XMLEventFactory2;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.lang.reflect.Field;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024
025import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
026import javax.xml.stream.XMLEventWriter;
027import javax.xml.stream.events.StartElement;
028import javax.xml.stream.events.XMLEvent;
029
030import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
031
032/**
033 * Represents a data type implementation.
034 *
035 * @param <TYPE>
036 *          the Java type of the underlying data value
037 */
038public interface IDataTypeAdapter<TYPE> {
039
040  /**
041   * Get the metaschema type names associated with this adapter. This name must be
042   * unique with respect to all other metaschema types.
043   * <p>
044   * At least one name must be provided, with the first name being the most
045   * preferred name.
046   *
047   * @return the name
048   */
049  @NonNull
050  List<QName> getNames();
051
052  /**
053   * Get the most preferred name for this data type.
054   *
055   * @return the name
056   */
057  @NonNull
058  default QName getPreferredName() {
059    return ObjectUtils.notNull(getNames().iterator().next());
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * The JSON primative type of the data type.
064   *
065   * @return the JSON data type
066   */
067  JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType();
068
069  /**
070   * Get the Java class supported by this adapter.
071   *
072   * @return the Java class
073   */
074  @NonNull
075  Class<TYPE> getJavaClass();
076
077  /**
078   * Casts the provided value to the type associated with this adapter.
079   *
080   * @param value
081   *          a value of the provided type
082   * @return the typed value
083   */
084  @NonNull
085  TYPE toValue(@NonNull Object value);
086
087  /**
088   * Gets the value as a string suitable for writing as text. This is intended for
089   * data types that have a simple string-based structure in XML and JSON, such as
090   * for XML attributes or JSON keys. An adapter for a complex data structures
091   * that consist of XML elements will throw an
092   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when this is called.
093   *
094   * @param value
095   *          the data to formatted as a string
096   * @return a string
097   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
098   *           if the data type cannot be represented as a string
099   */
100  @NonNull
101  String asString(@NonNull Object value);
102
103  /**
104   * Create a copy of the provided value.
105   *
106   * @param obj
107   *          the value to copy
108   * @return the copy
109   */
110  @NonNull
111  TYPE copy(@NonNull Object obj);
112
113  /**
114   * Determines if the data type is an atomic, scalar value. Complex structures
115   * such as Markup are not considered atomic.
116   *
117   * @return {@code true} if the data type is an atomic scalar value, or
118   *         {@code false} otherwise
119   */
120  default boolean isAtomic() {
121    return true;
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Get the java type of the associated item.
126   *
127   * @return the java associated item type
128   */
129  // TODO: move to IAnyAtomicItem
130  @NonNull
131  Class<? extends IAnyAtomicItem> getItemClass();
132
133  /**
134   * Construct a new item of this type using the provided value.
135   *
136   * @param value
137   *          the item's value
138   * @return a new item
139   */
140  // TODO: markup types are not atomic values.
141  // Figure out a better base type (i.e., IValuedItem)
142  // TODO: move to IAnyAtomicItem
143  @NonNull
144  IAnyAtomicItem newItem(@NonNull Object value);
145
146  /**
147   * Cast the provided item to an item of this type, if possible.
148   *
149   * @param item
150   *          the atomic item to cast
151   * @return an atomic item of this type
152   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
153   *           if the provided item type cannot be cast to this item type
154   */
155  // TODO: move to IAnyAtomicItem
156  @NonNull
157  IAnyAtomicItem cast(IAnyAtomicItem item);
158
159  /**
160   * Determines if adapter can parse the next element. The next element's
161   * {@link QName} is provided for this purpose.
162   * <p>
163   * This will be called when the parser encounter's an element it does not
164   * recognize. This gives the adapter a chance to request parsing of the data.
165   *
166   * @param nextElementQName
167   *          the next element's namespace-qualified name
168   * @return {@code true} if the adapter will parse the element, or {@code false}
169   *         otherwise
170   */
171  boolean canHandleQName(@NonNull QName nextElementQName);
172
173  /**
174   * Parses a provided string. Used to parse XML attributes, simple XML character
175   * data, and JSON/YAML property values.
176   *
177   * @param value
178   *          the string value to parse
179   * @return the parsed data as the adapter's type
180   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
181   *           if the data is not valid to the data type
182   */
183  @NonNull
184  TYPE parse(@NonNull String value);
185
186  /**
187   * This method is expected to parse content starting at the next event. Parsing
188   * will continue until the next event represents content that is not handled by
189   * this adapter. This means the event stream should be positioned after any
190   * {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT} that corresponds to an
191   * {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} parsed by this adapter.
192   * <p>
193   * If this method parses the {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} for the element that
194   * contains the value data, then this method must also parse the corresponding
195   * {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT}. Otherwise, the first event to parse will be the
196   * value data.
197   * <p>
198   * The value data is expected to be parsed completely, leaving the event stream
199   * on a peeked event corresponding to content that is not handled by this
200   * method.
201   *
202   * @param eventReader
203   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
204   * @return the parsed value
205   * @throws IOException
206   *           if a parsing error occurs
207   */
208  // TODO: migrate code to XML parser implementation.
209  @NonNull
210  TYPE parse(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException;
211
212  /**
213   * Parses a JSON property value.
214   *
215   * @param parser
216   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
217   * @return the parsed value
218   * @throws IOException
219   *           if a parsing error occurs
220   */
221  // TODO: migrate code to JSON parser implementation.
222  @NonNull
223  TYPE parse(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException;
224
225  /**
226   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(String)}.
227   * <p>
228   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
229   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
230   *
231   * @param value
232   *          the string value to parse
233   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
234   * @throws IOException
235   *           if an error occurs while parsing
236   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
237   *           if the provided value is invalid based on the data type
238   * @see #parse(String)
239   */
240  @NonNull
241  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull String value) throws IOException {
242    TYPE retval = parse(value);
243    return () -> copy(retval);
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Parses a provided string using
248   * {@link IDataTypeAdapter#parse(XMLEventReader2)}.
249   * <p>
250   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
251   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
252   *
253   * @param eventReader
254   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
255   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
256   * @throws IOException
257   *           if an error occurs while parsing
258   * @see #parse(String)
259   * @see #parse(XMLEventReader2)
260   */
261  // TODO: migrate code to XML parser implementation.
262  @NonNull
263  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException {
264    TYPE retval = parse(eventReader);
265    return () -> copy(retval);
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(JsonParser)}.
270   * <p>
271   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
272   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
273   *
274   * @param parser
275   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
276   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
277   * @throws IOException
278   *           if an error occurs while parsing
279   * @see #parse(String)
280   * @see #parse(JsonParser)
281   */
282  // TODO: migrate code to JSON parser implementation.
283  @NonNull
284  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException {
285    TYPE retval = parse(parser);
286    return () -> copy(retval);
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
291   * information is provided as a {@link StartElement} event, which allows
292   * namespace information to be obtained from the parent element using the
293   * {@link StartElement#getName()} and {@link StartElement#getNamespaceContext()}
294   * methods, which can be used when writing the provided instance value.
295   *
296   * @param instance
297   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
298   * @param parent
299   *          the {@link StartElement} XML event that is the parent of the data to
300   *          write
301   * @param eventFactory
302   *          the XML event factory used to generate XML writing events
303   * @param eventWriter
304   *          the XML writer used to output XML as events
305   * @throws IOException
306   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing to the output stream
307   */
308  // TODO: migrate code to XML writer implementation.
309  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull StartElement parent, @NonNull XMLEventFactory2 eventFactory,
310      @NonNull XMLEventWriter eventWriter)
311      throws IOException;
312
313  /**
314   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
315   * information is provided as an XML {@link QName}, which allows namespace
316   * information to be obtained from the parent element. Additional namespace
317   * information can be gathered using the
318   * {@link XMLStreamWriter2#getNamespaceContext()} method, which can be used when
319   * writing the provided instance value.
320   *
321   * @param instance
322   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
323   * @param parentName
324   *          the qualified name of the XML data's parent element
325   * @param writer
326   *          the XML writer used to output the XML data
327   * @throws IOException
328   *           if an unexpected error occurred while processing the XML output
329   */
330  // TODO: migrate code to XML writer implementation.
331  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull QName parentName, @NonNull XMLStreamWriter2 writer)
332      throws IOException;
333
334  /**
335   * Writes the provided Java class instance as a JSON/YAML field value.
336   *
337   * @param instance
338   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
339   * @param writer
340   *          the JSON/YAML writer used to output the JSON/YAML data
341   * @throws IOException
342   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing the JSON/YAML output
343   */
344  // TODO: migrate code to JSON writer implementation.
345  void writeJsonValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull JsonGenerator writer) throws IOException;
346
347  /**
348   * Gets the default value to use as the JSON/YAML field name for a Metaschema
349   * field value if no JSON value key flag or name is configured.
350   *
351   * @return the default field name to use
352   */
353  // TODO: migrate code to JSON implementations.
354  @NonNull
355  String getDefaultJsonValueKey();
356
357  /**
358   * Determines if the data type's value is allowed to be unwrapped in XML when
359   * the value is a field value.
360   *
361   * @return {@code true} if allowed, or {@code false} otherwise.
362   */
363  // TODO: migrate code to XML implementations.
364  boolean isUnrappedValueAllowedInXml();
365
366  /**
367   * Determines if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in XML.
368   *
369   * @return {@code true} if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in
370   *         XML, or {@code false} otherwise
371   */
372  // TODO: migrate code to XML implementations.
373  boolean isXmlMixed();
374}
